full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### M-20 Room. 258a Server Room Renovations

The National Research Council Canada (NRC) is seeking a contractor for the renovation of the server room in M-20 Building, Room 258A, located on the Montreal Road Campus.

#### Important Details

* **Project Description:** The successful contractor will be responsible for the installation of a client-supplied server rack (HPC cluster) within Room 258A.
* **Mandatory Criteria:**
	+ The contractor must have a minimum of 10 years of experience as a general contractor, providing construction services comparable to this tender.
	+ The proposed construction site supervisor must possess a minimum of 7 years of experience in contract/construction administration, as a site supervisor or similar position.
	+ The proposed project manager must possess a minimum of 7 years of experience in contract/construction administration, as a project manager or similar position.

#### Evaluation Procedures

The construction tender form (bid) will be evaluated and scored in accordance with specific evaluation criteria. It is imperative that these criteria be addressed in sufficient depth in the tender form to fully describe the contractor's response.

#### Mandatory Site Visit

The bidder is required to attend one of the scheduled site visits at the designated date and time. The site visits will be held on October 11th and October 12th, 2023 at 9:00 am. Meet Benoit Ranger at Building M-20, Main Entrance, 1200 Montreal Road Ottawa, ON. Bidders who fail to attend one of the specified dates and time will not be given an alternative appointment to view the site.

#### Tendering Information

* **Tender Closing Date:** October 31, 2023, 14:00 EDT
* **Tender Results:** Following the evaluation, the tender results will be sent by email to all contractors who submitted a tender.

#### Additional Requirements

* **Trade Agreements:** The contractor must comply with the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* **Regions of Operation:** The contractor must be eligible to work within the National Capital Region (NCR).

#### Contact Information

For any questions or concerns, please contact Tania Backes at Tania.Backes@NRC-CNRC.GC.CA or (613) 410-3834. Please note that any information received other than from the Departmental Representative or the Contracting Authority will be disregarded when awarding the contract and during construction.
